What good is the UN doing for us? Their headquarters is in New York and they rack up parking tickets and never have to pay them (millions of dollars). We currently provide about 22% of their funding every year. And what do we get in return? Well Kofi continues to defy our ambitions to remove Saddam and even recommend that we not go into Fallujah. They also want to postpone elections in Iraq. On top of it all, the UN was working behind the scenes illegally with Saddam. They helped him stay in power when their objective was to force him to comply with their sanctions. However, they knowingly allowed him to defy these resolutions and even helped him gain wealth while at the same time putting his citizens in worse poverty. The money he got illegally from the UN was even used to pay the families of Palestinian suicide bombers!! Kofi's son was even being paid by one of the UN contractor's over $125,000 over the 5 years the oil-for-food program went on.
 
 With out intentions of rooting out terrorism and making our country and the world safer, can we trust the UN? Or better yet, can we trust Kofi? How has he not been fired/impeached? He aided terrorism, he bribed and received illegal funds, etc and nothing is being done about it. Many members of the UN wanted a no confidence vote against him!!

post_info.post_title: Should we kick the UN out of New York?

Corruption like that is abhorrent. It should never happen.
 
 BUT, the UN shouldn't be disbanded, only remodeled. One problem is the fact that with the structure of the Security Council, the peace-enforcment arm of the UN, it is fairly ineffectual when it comes to actually administering justice and enforcing peace.
 
 There are 5 permanent members, all of whom have veto power. So how many Security Council resolutions do you think are passed on these countries? None, of course. So, basically, it's these 5 countries running the real show when and where it counts. 
 
 So, for the most part, the UN is a stick that a lot of countries can pick up and use, but only within the permission of certain more powerful countries.
 
 So, if we kick the UN out of New York and give up our membership, we'd lose veto power and other members of the Security Council would start finding reasons to pass resolutions against us. That might start some fights that we don't want.
 
 Or do you just want the meeting place moved to free up traffic and parking?

the object shouldnt be to get rid of it completely. though it hasnt made much progress yet, and probably wont for a while, we want to have some sort of unity. i do agree that all information should be accessable so things like the saddam situation does not occur, but that overall united sub-control should be encouraged, if anything.

I just find it hard to believe that the UN, whose purpose is to maintain world peace and security, is out there doing the exact opposite. They sat there throughout Rwanda and Somalia and did nothing. They are doing next to nothing in Sudan. They might as well tell Iran that they can make WMDs. They helped Saddam remain in power and refused to allow anyone to take action against him. Either the UN needs to be completely revamped and/or Kofi needs to go. Actually, he does need to go. With all the acts of fraud and corruption, why is he still the Secretary General?
 
 We should make the people in New York pay their parking tickets. They're no better than me and you, and hell we're paying parking tickets.
